# Research Question

- English as Lingua Franca (ELF)

???
Communication between two non-native speakers in English
Example: to keep the ball flat vs. to keep our feet on the ground
--

- Increasingly more text and speeches in non-native English

--

-  Challenging for translators

???
ELF is more time and work demanding
--

- Enhanced cognitive load while translating
---

# Research Question

Mixed method approach that addresses:

--

- Problems reading and translating ELF text

--

- Language proficiency depending differences while reading and translating EdE vs. ELF text

--

- Cognitive load while reading and translating EdE vs. ELF text

--

<t>using:</t>

--

- EEG

- Eyetracking

# Reading task


```{r warning= FALSE, message=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
source(file.path("R/Preprocessing/psychometrics.R"))
source(file.path("R/reading_task.R"))

readingDuration_trimmed_t1_select <- readingDuration_trimmed_t1 %>% 
  select(group,condition, avgReadingDuration)

tbl_strata(
  readingDuration_trimmed_t1_select,
  strata = c(group),
  .tbl_fun =
    ~ .x %>%
    tbl_summary(by = condition,
                label = avgReadingDuration ~ "Average reading duration per sentence in s",
                type = avgReadingDuration ~ "continuous2",
                statistic = list(all_continuous() ~ 
                                   c("{mean}",
                                     "{median} ({p25}, {p75})", 
                                     "{min}, {max}")),
                missing = "no")
)    %>% 
  modify_header(label = "**Variable**") %>% # update the column header
  modify_caption("**Reading duration text 1: Social information and energy conservation**") %>% 
  bold_labels() %>%
  italicize_levels()

```

# Copying Task

- Efficiency: 
  - Total amount of chars typed

- Deletions: 

  - Total amount of backslashes proportional to total amount of chars

- Stringdist: 

  - Optimal string aligment distance (restricted Damerau-Levenshtein distance)

---
# Translation Task

- Efficiency: 

 - Total amount of chars typed

- Deletions: 

  - Total amount of backslashes proportional to total amount of chars

Rating of<sup>1</sup>:

- Fluency

- Accuracy

compared to reference translation

.footnote[
  1) Koehn & Monz (2006)
  ]
---
# Cognitive load in EEG
.pull-left[

Cognitive load theory (CLT): 

- Cognitive load measures the occupied space of working memory<sup>1</sup>

- Intrinsic cognitive load reflects mental effort, depending of difficulty of task<sup>2</sup>

- Alpha ERD and theta ERS<sup>3</sup>

- Holm et al. (2009): Fz-theta / Pz-alpha - Ratio

.footnote[
  1) Mills et al. (2019)  
  2) Anderson et al. (2011)  
  3) Antonenko et al. (2010)  
  ]
]
.pull-right[
Looking at:

1) Reading task

- ELF vs. SE

- Language expertise (Tra vs Mul)

2) Translating task

- Copying task vs. Translating task

- ELF vs. SE

- Language expertise (Tra vs Mul)

]

source(file.path("R/Preprocessing/psychometrics.R"))

psych_select <- psychometrics %>% 
  select(group, age, gender, handedness)

psych_select$gender <- droplevels(psych_select$gender)

tbl_summary(
  psych_select,
  label = list(age ~ "Age", gender ~ "Gender", handedness ~ "Handedness"),
  by = group, # split table by group
  type = all_continuous() ~ "continuous2",
  statistic = list(all_categorical() ~ "{n} ({p}%)",
                   all_continuous() ~ c("{mean}",
                                        "{median} ({p25}, {p75})", 
                                        "{min}, {max}")),
) %>%
  #  add_n() %>% # add column with total number of non-missing observations
  add_p() %>% # test for a difference between groups
  modify_header(label = "**Variable**") %>% # update the column header
  modify_caption("**Sample characteristics**") %>% 
  bold_labels() %>%
  italicize_levels()
